summary: A forwarded email from November 21, 2019, sent to Eddy Aragon, containing an anonymous extortion attempt. The sender claims to be a former staff member at 'the Zorro' (likely referring to Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico) and alleges they possess damning video and audio evidence taken from Epstein's home, including claims of murders. The sender demands 1 bitcoin payment in exchange for a USB drive containing the material.

persons.name: Eddy Aragon
persons.role: Email recipient, target of extortion attempt
persons.context: The email is forwarded to him; he is the apparent target of an anonymous extortion attempt involving alleged Epstein materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email alleges possession of video and audio evidence taken from his home, and makes claims of his involvement in murders.

persons.name: Madam G
persons.context: Referred to in the email; allegedly gave orders related to the burial of two girls and received a suicide confession from a girl.

persons.name: Matthew Mellon
persons.role: Named in context of alleged video
persons.context: Mentioned in the description of one of the alleged video files ('Matthew Mellon video').

connections.description: The email alleges they jointly ordered the burial of two foreign girls who died during rough sex.

events.title: Alleged Murder and Burial of Two Girls
events.description: The email claims that 'two foreign girls were buried on orders of Jeffrey and Madam G' after dying by strangulation during rough, fetish sex somewhere in the hills outside 'the Zorro'.

events.title: Bitcoin Payment Deadline
events.description: The anonymous sender demands payment of 1 bitcoin by this date in exchange for sending a USB drive containing the alleged evidence.

locations: Zorro (likely referring to Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico)
keyFacts: The document is an anonymous extortion email claiming to be from a former staff member at Epstein's Zorro Ranch.
It makes a highly serious, unverified allegation that two foreign girls were murdered (died by strangulation) during rough sex and were buried on orders from Jeffrey Epstein and 'Madam G'.

The sender claims to possess specific video and audio files taken from Epstein's home as 'insurance,' including videos allegedly depicting sex with minors, threesomes, a 'rape fantasy,' and an audio confession from a girl who attempted suicide.
The email demands a payment of 1 bitcoin to a specified wallet address by November 22, 2019, in exchange for a USB drive containing the materials.
The communication style suggests a possible scam or hoax, but the document itself is part of the released case files.
